places_with_reviews.name: Aamby Valley City
address: Aamby Valley Internal Road, near Post Office Ambavane, taluka Mulshi, Lonavla, Maharashtra 410401, India

reviews.text: For a peaceful retreat, the experience and the location are excellent altogether. The room service was attractive, and the rooms themselves were wonderful.This place is gorgeous, with amazing views, architecture, and nature. The lake view area and the large swings were great draws. The personnel was amiable, focused, and went above and beyond to make sure that the customer had an amazing experience. The service was flawless. My visit was made extremely pleasurable by the attention to detail in every element, from the amenities and facilities to the caliber of the meals. To anyone looking for a lovely combination of top-notch service and a picturesque setting, I heartily suggest this.

The ambiance and setting are ideal for a tranquil retreat. The accommodations were pleasing, and the room service was commendable. The lakeside vista and expansive swings were particularly captivating, set amidst stunning surroundings with breathtaking scenery and architecture. Service was flawless; the staff was affable, attentive, and exceeded expectations to create an unforgettable experience. Attention to detail was evident in every aspect, from amenities to culinary offerings, making my stay thoroughly enjoyable. I enthusiastically endorse this destination to anyone in search of exceptional service combined with a scenic backdrop.

The experience and the overall place is really nice for a quiet getaway. The rooms were nice and the room service was also pretty.The lake view area and the big swings were a major attraction and the location is stunning, offering breathtaking scenery/views/architecture. The service was impeccable; the staff was friendly, attentive, and went above and beyond to ensure a memorable visit. The attention to detail in every aspect, from amenities/facilities to the quality of the food made my stay truly enjoyable. I highly recommend this to anyone seeking a delightful blend of excellent service and a picturesque setting.

Place is just heaven and well maintained. It could be fairy garden in rainy days. It's too beautiful. Just roam around by walking, gives peace.
Service is bit not up to mark as we struggle much on cottage access and also we face some water and food service issue.
Overall staff is very friendly and helpful as they immediately act on issue and tried to resolve.

Well-maintained beautiful landscaped environment. Good rooms but service takes long given the distances. Food also is very expensive, even more than 5 star rates. Excellent place for a rejuvenating weekend stay.

places_with_reviews.name: SaffronStays Fragrant Sun
address: GCRQ+VPH, Unnamed Road, Paud, Maharashtra 412108, India

reviews.text:
This probably is the best home-stays i have ever been to.
From location to the cottages, the hosts, beautiful dining spaces, and the Food, everything was amaazing.
We spent a couple of nights there and were blown away by this artsy, earthy, perfectly curated place.
The hosts Sanjeev, Kavita and their team are so nice and friendly.
Awesome place,food and Hospitality 10/10.. Owner of resort are very cool and friendly..Staff is very nice..we stayed 2 days and had super experience..would definately like to visit again.

We had an amazing time at Fragrant Sun during our recent holidays. Accompanied by friends and three toddlers, everyone thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The serene and stunning lake, just a short walk away, added to the beauty of the place. The delectable food, made with quality ingredients from nearby farms, was a delight. The labor of love from Sanjiv and Kavita was evident in every thoughtful element, from antique furniture to room decor and food choices. Seeing the pictures of the place's transformation only added to our admiration for their perseverance and passion. We highly recommend Fragrant Sun and can't wait to visit again.

This was one of the most beautiful homestays that we have stayed in in Maharashtra.
Everything was impeccable - the rooms were huge and came with beautiful views of the Mulshi lake, the food was absolutely scrumptious (and they veganised it too) and the staff was ever so courteous and kind.

The whole property, every little nook and corner, has been so thoughtfully curated that you would find yourself at peace everywhere. Thank you once again for the absolutely calming and peaceful stay, we will keep coming back for more.
Serene. Peaceful. Delicious food. Calm lake. Need I say more.

places_with_reviews.name: Inodaya Retreat
address: GAT 182, Village, Barpe Bk., Maharashtra 412108, India

reviews.text:
Property is luxury and beautiful. Also good and  hygiene but there's no parking facility.. no food Variety..after paying 20k no facility.
U need to pay If u reach half n hour early u need to pay 2000 for early check-in per hour.. I will not recommend this to anybody.. in 20k u can get good facilities and food varieties.. other retreat or resort they don't charge for early check-in. In other resort they charge for extra amusement activities only.

Very serene location, excellent vibe, lovely hosts and delicious food!
We went on a weekday for an overnight stay and got lucky as there were no other guests. Right from handholding us to take the correct route to setting up a special birthday surprise for my wife, everything minute detail was sorted by Shailja and Siddharth! The place has been very thoughtfully set up looks like a fairyland when the lights come on at night. The rooms had a great view, the bathrooms are super with an open air bath tub.
All 3 meals were excellent and we ended up overeating every time.
Overall it is a great place to go and relax and blend with nature!

Even though I just went for a night came back with wonderful memories and will surely be going back
The location is fabulous ri stayed in a tent which was very clean comfortable and right on the edge of the hill .. watched a stunning sunrise from my tent !!! The property is beautiful and has a rustic and homely feel .. the staff were very attentive and efficient
Especially the hosts Siddharth and Shailja .. food was great .. wonderful getaway with family / friends / solo
Will visit again soon ..

I had a wonderful time at Inodaya Retreat! It's a small gem tucked away in a peaceful corner. The staff was incredibly friendly and made me feel at home from the moment I arrived. They know what luxury is and how to provide it!

The cottages were clean, cozy, and had a calming atmosphere. The natural surroundings were breathtaking, and it was the perfect place to unwind and rest.

The food was delicious, and I loved the variety of healthy options they offered. It felt like they genuinely cared about my well-being during my stay.

Overall, Inodaya Retreat exceeded my expectations, and I can't wait to visit again. If you're looking for a peaceful getaway with warm hospitality, this is the place to be!

Highly recommended!

"Amidst mountains that tell tales and a lake that reflects serenity, Inodaya Retreat weaved moments into memories, creating a sanctuary uniquely ours. The hospitality, breathtaking views, idyllic location, delectable food, and cozy stay exceeded our expectations. A heartfelt thank you to Shailja and Siddharth for making us feel like home. Already counting the days until our next visit."😊

places_with_reviews.name: Aussie Rooms
address: J97R+HFX, Aamby Valley City, Maharashtra 412108, India

reviews.text:
Pathetic place. Very bad service. The rooms between aussie and Spanish are so far away (5-6 kms) and they keep making you wait for car facilities. We had to wait for one hour. Only to get the same service delivered after paykng the cab drivers money.
The hotel's food and rooms are pathetic as well.
There are rats in the rooms.

Property isnt maintained at all!

The rooms are good and spacious but are noisy since they are made of wood. The cracking sounds comes when the upstairs guest walks on the floor. Can be irritating in the night.

Food is expensive.

Need to have car to roam around.

Need cart from room to car parking. Need to call and wait for the cart to arrive which can be frustating if they are late.
We came here with a group of 200+ for our annual get together for a couple of days. Had heard about this place. Found it 2x better. Must go to place about 25km from Lonavala
Leaky bathroom ceiling, could have showered sitting on the commode. Chairs knocked over in the balcony. Table glass top lying carelessly on the balcony floor

The location of Amby Valley, while great, the upkeep is very poor now. Rooms as well as the common areas are in need of lot of maintenance.
The water was leaking on ground floor room during the last stay from the bathroom above.
And the AC ducts seems have never been cleaned.
The phone extension in room does not work and to even get a bottle of water is a stretch.

places_with_reviews.name: Aussie Suite
address: Unnamed Road, J97R+F28, Aamby Valley City, Maharashtra 412108, India

reviews.text: Nice comfortable and spacious rooms built using pine wood. A bit of walk from the reception - electric buggies are available. The climb to the upper rooms is a bit steep. You need to be careful of the monkeys around. Service is a bit slow - expect 30 to 45 minutes for any room service order. Food is also quite expensive, starting from Rs 800 plus for any dish.

I have recently visited Aamby valley city and had a stay in Aussie Chalet, the ambiance of the chalet was great! There are many activities to do in Aamby Valley but what I have experienced is they don’t have knowledgeable staff to guide you about the city so you miss many activities and the food menu in all the restaurants in the city is regular menu with three times prices ,quality of the food is disgusting! So basically you are just paying for the stay and good amenities and Instagram worth pics that’s all !

Honest review, the location is beautiful,inside Aamby its very peaceful,  but travelling inside Aamby is a little headache if you don't have your car.  Aussie villa is huge and beautiful but of course its made if wood so it has a smell to it.

Definitely Aamby Valley is not a good place to be. They charged ₹15000 for an Aussie room but I have to go and park my own car. Wait for the Buggy to come for another 10min. Leave my car in parking and then enter the room areas.
If by any chance I forget anything in  car I have to call the buggy first, sit in it and go to my car and then come back again the same way.

Pathetic handling by Aamby Valley.

ALSO OUTSIDE LIQUOR IS NOT ALLOWED. WHY ?

Even the Taj and Marriott’s of the world allow outside liquor

What kind of pathetic money making SCHEME is this ?

Terrible place to stay. It's a terrible room. The balcony doors barely lock, space is used poorly (like the cupboard and locker being in the bathroom), there was Chiwda fallen in the sofa-cum-bed. One of our room's AC was heating up the room instead of cooling. The room was very unhygienic with stains on the hand towels, tears and stains on the below bed footrest, and the aforementioned Chiwda (I cannot speak about COVID cleaning). The service was bad as well. They didn't pick up the phone at all and took too long to do send room service (the food came from the Woodpecker which is whole another story) , make the sofa-cum-bed, and other arrangements. After all of this, consider the price. The place is far too expensive to be this bad. 0/10 would not recommend

places_with_reviews.name: The White Valley farm
address: SR/No , 20/2 , Shirvali, Village, Mulshi, Pomgaon, Maharashtra 412108, India

reviews.text:
From the moment we arrived, we were blown away by the beauty of the surroundings
The staff at the White Valley were exceptional. They were friendly, helpful, and went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable.
The natural beauty of the surroundings, the luxurious accommodations, and the exceptional staff all contributed to an unforgettable stay. We would highly recommend this property to anyone looking for a peaceful and rejuvenating getaway.
